thread.title: Fighting, flag-stealing, tear gas and riot police: Brazilian match quickly descends into astonishing mass brawl
thread.title_full: Fighting, flag-stealing, tear gas and riot police: Brazilian match quickly descends into astonishing mass brawl

author: Richard Innes
title: Fighting, flag-stealing, tear gas and riot police: Brazilian match quickly descends into astonishing mass brawl
text:
Get daily   Could   
South American football is known for being particularly, er… 'combustible'. 
Over the years, we have seen countless examples of games in that part of the world descending into chaos. However, even by the standards of the previous incidents, the clip you can see above - from a regional league in Brazil - may represent a new level of insanity. 
The footage comes from a match between Gama and Brasiliense. With the scores at 1-1, Brasiliense striker Nunes appears to elbow Gama defender Dudu Gago. 
Cue absolute bedlam. At first, it appears to be simply the players who have lost their heads. However, as you can see in the video, it soon escalates… in a big, big way. Before you know it, fans are fighting over a giant flag. In what feels like mere moments after the initial foul that sparked the madness, tear gas is being fired onto the pitch as riot police steam in. Suffice to say, the referee was forced to abandon the match. Well, can't really blame him, can you? Like us on Facebook
